instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3588: What is 820-3588? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Imac 21.5 late 2013 a1418 (emc 2638) display not working no 4th diagnostic led
threads.message:
Hello, 
I'm trying to repair an iMac A1418 (EMC 2638) which have a display fault. 
Seems on cold boot display works on a black screen; the time span is a few minutes before the display fails. 
I tried an external monitor and it works, correctly. 
The board is a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A. 

When the display is active and alive, I think all values ??are ok: 
Diagnostic LED: # 1 ON # 2 ON # 3 ON # 4 ON 

J8100 
<SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_1</SIGNAL> 4.5V (sometimes 11,5V) 
<SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_2</SIGNAL> 4,5V (sometimes 11,5V ) 
<SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_3</SIGNAL> 4.5V (sometimes 11,5V) 
<SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_4</SIGNAL> 4.5V (sometimes 11,5V) 
<SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_5</SIGNAL> 4,5V (sometimes 11,5V) 
<SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_6</SIGNAL> 4,5V (sometimes 11,5V) 
<SIGNAL>BKLT_BOOST_1</SIGNAL> 61,3V
<SIGNAL>BKLT_BOOST_2</SIGNAL> 61.4V 

L440 
<SIGNAL>PP12V_LCD_F</SIGNAL> 12,1V 
<SIGNAL>PP12V_LCD</SIGNAL> 12,1V 

When the 
LED goes black, I have: Diagnostic LED: # 1 ON # 2 ON # 3 ON # 4 OFF 

J8100 
All 0V 

L440 
<SIGNAL>PP12V_LCD_F</SIGNAL> 12,1V 
<SIGNAL>PP12V_LCD</SIGNAL> 12,1V 

VSYNC Cable with no sign of shorts. 

Any hint? 
Thanks

threads.title: Imac 21.5 late 2013 a1418 (emc 2638) display not working no 4th diagnostic led
threads.message:
I'm not sure if I correctly understood you.
Always has image, only disappers the backlight?

Did you try known good LCD and video cable?
Reseat video cable on the MLB and the backside of LCD too.

Any history available?

threads.title: Imac 21.5 late 2013 a1418 (emc 2638) display not working no 4th diagnostic led
threads.message:
On cold boot always have an image. After random period, i have no image e no backlight.
I have also removed <DIODE>D4450</DIODE> and replaced <CAPACITOR>C4451</CAPACITOR> with a jumper (temporarily). Same behavior.
It's the lcd panel?

threads.title: Imac 21.5 late 2013 a1418 (emc 2638) display not working no 4th diagnostic led
threads.message:
If image disappears too, try first other display.
Backlight issue should not block the image output.
Looks more like LCD issue...

threads.title: Imac 21.5 late 2013 a1418 (emc 2638) display not working no 4th diagnostic led
threads.message: When the image and backlight both disappears, the 4th check LED goes off. Only chance is to replace the LCD? any chance to repair the lcd?

threads.title: Imac 21.5 late 2013 a1418 (emc 2638) display not working no 4th diagnostic led
threads.message:
Try other display first; an LCD issue needs to be confirmed.
Be sure to have good contacts on both sides of video cable.
Also try other video cable.

threads.title: Imac 21.5 late 2013 a1418 (emc 2638) display not working no 4th diagnostic led
threads.message: Ok, ordered a display and a new cable. I will be back after the installation. Thanks

threads.title: Imac 21.5 late 2013 a1418 (emc 2638) display not working no 4th diagnostic led
threads.message:
Installed new screen and all fine. 
It is not possible to repair the lcd board?
